resources.string: Please describe your item to find a place for it.
including newsprint; ledger paper; computer paper; corrugated cardboard; and mixed paper.

including intact or repairable home or industrial appliances; household goods; clothing; intact materials in demolition debris, such as lumber; building materials such as doors, windows, cabinets, and sinks; business supplies and equipment; lighting fixtures; and any manufactured item or naturally occurring object that can be repaired or used again as is.
including both ferrous and nonferrous, including cans; parts from abandoned vehicles; plumbing; fences; metal doors and screens; tools; machinery; and any other discarded metal objects.
including glass containers and window glass.
including nonreusable clothing; upholstery; and pieces of fabric.
including beverage containers; plastic packaging; plastic cases of consumer goods such as telephones or electronic equipment; films and tires
including leaves and cuttings; trimmings from trees, shrubs, and grass; whole plants, and sawdust.
including animal, fruit, and vegetable debris; cooked food; manures; offal; and sewage sludge.
including unreusable lumber; tree rounds; and pallets.
\nincluding rock; tile; china; brick; concrete; plaster; and asphalt.
including excavation soils from barren or developed land; and excess soils from people\\'s yards.
including acids; bases; solvents; fuels; lubricating oils; and medicines.
Maximum distance to track disposal places
Receive a notification whenever a new place accepting one of your current items becomes available
